translations: v.（以……）结束，告终；到达顶点，达到高潮；<旧>（天体）达于中天，到子午线

sentences.sentence: Their summer tour will culminate at a spectacular concert in London.
sentences.translation: 在伦敦举行的一场精彩的音乐会将为他们的夏季巡回演出画上句号。

sentences.sentence: The American singer Diana Ross, the main performer at the introductory ceremonies, led an elaborate song-and-dance number that was to culminate in a triumphant shot.
sentences.translation: 美国歌星戴安娜.罗斯（注：老友记里有一集钱德勒调侃莫妮卡头发的桥段就是说她）是开幕式的主要演出嘉宾，在一段精心编排的歌舞之后，以一记惊天射门引爆全场。

sentences.sentence: The full version will provide a detailed comparison of the five options presented in the summary report – including one plan that would culminate in a trip to Mars orbit.
sentences.translation: 报告的完整版本将提供对摘要报告里的五个方案的详细比较——其中包括一项以在最终完成火星轨道飞行为目标的计划。
